0.title: Delhi man kills 70-yr-old for not giving money to buy liquor; held
0.article_body: A vagabond allegedly killed a 70-year-old tea stall owner in Delhi after he refused to give him money to consume liquor, police said. The 44-year-old accused, who used to keep his money with the victim, hit him on his head with a stick when he was asleep. Police have arrested the accused with the help of over 30 CCTV footages.

1.title: Sonakshi & I share an absolutely platonic friendship: Zaheer Iqbal
1.article_body: Actor Zaheer Iqbal said he shares "an absolutely platonic friendship" with Sonakshi Sinha and that their dating rumours "started with a prank". Zaheer will be seen sharing screen space with Sonakshi in 'Double XL'. Talking about working with his "best friend", Zaheer said, "Working with Sonakshi in every possible way has been one of the best experiences of my life."

2.title: Producers didn't want to work with me after wedding rumours with Mehmood: Aruna
2.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani in an interview opened up about the rumours of her wedding with actor-filmmaker Mehmood. She said, "I don't know how that rumour started...No producer was ready to work with me." Aruna added, "Dada Kondke (actor and producer) offered me a song in his Marathi film 'Andhala Maarto Dola'. That's how I started working again."

3.title: 16-yr-old Aayan Afzal Khan becomes youngest cricketer to play in T20 World Cup history
3.article_body: UAE all-rounder Aayan Afzal Khan on Sunday became the youngest-ever cricketer to feature in a men's T20 World Cup match, achieving the feat during his team's match against Netherlands in Geelong. Aayan set the record at the age of 16 years and 335 days. The previous record was held by Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir (17 years and 55 days).

4.title: Akhilesh to fund studies of boy who ran away from home to attend Mulayam's funeral
4.article_body: After a 10-year-old boy claimed that he ran away from his home to pay tributes to SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav in UP's Saifai, party chief Akhilesh Yadav has announced to fund his studies. "[Akhilesh] has also called this child again after a few days," a party leader said. The video of the boy's interaction with railway police went viral.

5.title: Magician OP Sharma, who performed in over 36,000 shows, passes away
5.article_body: Indian magician OP Sharma, who performed in more than 36,000 shows, has passed away. He died after a prolonged illness at a hospital in Kanpur on Saturday night. He was in his eighties. He started performing magic at the age of five. OP Sharma grew up in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district and did his engineering from Kanpur.

6.title: Afghanistan can beat anyone anytime, they've good bowling line-up: Aakash
6.article_body: Ahead of Afghanistan's upcoming match against England in T20 World Cup 2022, Aakash Chopra said that Afghanistan can beat anyone anytime. "If we talk about their strengths, this team has a good bowling line-up. They've three spinners, they want to stifle you, whether it's Mujeeb Ur Rahman, Rashid Khan or Mohammad Nabi," he added. Match will be played on Saturday.

7.title: BJP to hold CEC meet for Himachal Pradesh polls on Tuesday: Reports
7.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, the BJP is likely to hold a meeting of the Central Election Committee (CEC) on Tuesday to finalise the candidates. Earlier on Saturday, Union Home Minister Amit Shah launched the party's campaign song "Himachal Ki Pukar Fir BJP ki Sarkar" for the elections. The state will go to polls on November 12.

8.title: Prez Murmu undergoes cataract surgery at Delhi's Army Hospital
8.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu underwent cataract surgery at the Army Hospital in Delhi on Sunday, a Rashtrapati Bhavan spokesperson said. The surgery was successful and she has been discharged from the hospital, the spokesperson said. The surgery was carried out by a team of doctors led by Brigadier Sanjay Kumar Mishra, who had last year operated former President Ram Nath Kovind.

9.title: Nayanthara-Vignesh got legally married 6 years ago, surrogate a relative: Report
9.article_body: Actress Nayanthara and her filmmaker-husband Vignesh Shivan, who tied the knot in a ceremony in June this year, legally registered their marriage six years ago, reports citing an affidavit claimed. The couple announced the birth of their twin boys earlier this month and are facing a probe over surrogacy. According to the affidavit, Nayanthara's relative was the surrogate mother.

10.title: India aims for crypto SOPs during G20 presidency: Sitharaman
10.article_body: Stating that all countries want cryptocurrency to not be misutilised, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that during its G20 presidency, India is aiming to develop standard operating procedures (SOPs) for cryptocurrency. Sitharaman said that she wants G20 countries to develop a technology-driven regulatory framework. She added that individually no country can effectively regulate crypto.

11.title: We are not dead, we are just turning 30: Cartoon Network
11.article_body: Cartoon Network's official Twitter account tweeted, "Y'all we're not dead, we're just turning 30." The channel's clarification came after reports said Warner Bros. Animation and Cartoon Network Studios would be merged, following which fans assumed Cartoon Network would be shut down. Several people shared their memories of Cartoon Network and #RIPCartoonNetwork was trending on Twitter.

12.title: 2 Ugandan districts put under 3-week lockdown amid Ebola outbreak
12.article_body: The Ugandan government has announced a three-week lockdown and curfew in two districts, Mubende and Kassanda, amid an outbreak of Ebola cases. The country's President Yoweri Museveni on Saturday said that a total of 19 people have died from the disease and there are 58 confirmed cases. He added that 20 people have recovered from the disease so far.

13.title: Foreign investors withdraw ₹7,500 crore from Indian equities in October
13.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have withdrawn about ₹7,500 crore in the first two weeks of October amid concerns about rate hikes in the US and the falling value of the Rupee. Data from depositories showed that FPIs had withdrawn ₹1.76 lakh crore in total in 2022. Apart from equities, FPIs have withdrawn ₹2,079 crore from the debt market in October.

14.title: Gandhi's grandson breaks down while talking on Nehru, says 'Filthy lies spread about him'
14.article_body: Historian and Mahatma Gandhi's grandson Rajmohan Gandhi broke down while talking about India's first PM Jawaharlal Nehru at Khushwant Singh Litfest in Kasauli. "You can criticise the policies of Nehru, but don't stoop low by spreading filthy lies about a nobleman," he said. "Nehru loved the Himalayas. The Himalayas would protest and the earth would protest too," he added.

15.title: 200 people migrate to Mumbai daily: CEO of Dharavi redevelopment
15.article_body: Daily over 200 people migrate to Mumbai, of which 70% are intra-state migrants, said CEO of Dharavi redevelopment project SVR Srinivas. There is a need to create effective rental housing schemes in the city due to the large influx of migrants, he added. If Dharavi and Govandi slums are taken care of, Mumbai will definitely become slum-free, he further said.

16.title: 6 of top 10 most valued firms lose ₹78,163 cr in m-cap; RIL loses most
16.article_body: Combined market capitalisation (m-cap) of six of the top 10 most valued firms fell by ₹78,163 crore in the last week as 30-share Sensex index declined 271.32 points. Reliance Industries' m-cap fell the most, falling ₹42,113.47 crore to ₹16.04 lakh crore. Reliance was followed by Bharti Airtel, losing ₹15,159.81 crore in m-cap, and ICICI Bank, losing ₹8,272.37 crore in m-cap.

17.title: It's been a historic day for us: Erasmus on Namibia's win vs SL in T20 WC
17.article_body: Following Namibia's 55-run win against Sri Lanka in Group A match in T20 World Cup, Namibia captain Gerhard Erasmus said, "It's been a historic day for us." He added, "Opening day has been quite special but we want to kick on from here and qualify for...Super 12 stage." Chasing 164, Sri Lanka were bowled out for 108 in 19 overs.

18.title: 8,300 kgs of banned firecrackers seized from warehouse near Gurugram
18.article_body: Officials from the Haryana Chief Minister's flying squad seized 8,343 kilograms of traditional firecrackers from a warehouse in Dabodha village in Gurugram's Farrukhnagar. This consignment of banned crackers has been the largest ever to be seized in Haryana, officials said. The consignment was brought from Sivakasi in Tamil Nadu and the estimated price of the seized firecrackers at ₹1 crore.

19.title: Prithviraj's first look from Prabhas-starrer 'Salaar' revealed
19.article_body: Prashanth Neel, director of the upcoming movie 'Salaar', on Sunday shared a poster revealing Prithviraj Sukumaran's first look from the film. The filmmaker shared the poster on the occasion of Prithviraj's birthday. "Birthday Wishes to the most versatile Prithviraj. Presenting 'Vardharaja Mannaar' from #Salaar," Prashanth wrote. The action-thriller film will also feature Prabhas and Shruti Haasan.

20.title: We had big names in the last year's WC, but we didn't qualify: Pooran
20.article_body: With as many as 12 players, who featured in their last year's World Cup squad missing from their current squad for the 2022 T20 World Cup, West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran has said the presence of "big names" doesn't guarantee success. "A lot of guys [in WI's squad] haven't played in Australia...but the guys are confident, they're happy," he added.

21.title: 67-yr-old businessman abducted from UP’s Bulandshahr rescued within 24 hrs
21.article_body: A 67-year-old businessman, who was allegedly abducted when he was out on a morning walk in UP’s Bulandshahr, was traced and rescued within 24 hours, police said on Sunday. "During questioning, he said his abductors left him and fled after they saw police checking vehicles...We have got certain clues and our teams are working on it," SSP Shlok Kumar said.

22.title: Necessary for independent-minded countries to speak their minds: EAM
22.article_body: While interacting with the Indian diaspora in Egypt, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar expressed concern over the struggle of countries thriving in a polarised world. "It is necessary for independent-minded countries to speak their minds...Richer countries are not fully grasping how poorer countries are being hurt by what's happening in the world," said Jaishankar.

23.title: Paddington bears left as tribute for Queen Elizabeth to be donated
23.article_body: Over 1,000 Paddington bears and other teddy bears left as a tribute to the late Queen Elizabeth II will be donated to a children's charity, Buckingham Palace said on Saturday. The Queen was linked to the children's literary character Paddington after they both appeared in a video together during Platinum Jubilee celebrations to mark her 70 years of service.

24.title: Alia Bhatt is fabulous performer; her ease, prep is incredible: Sidharth
24.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra has called actress Alia Bhatt a fabulous performer. Earlier, Sidharth was rumoured to be dating Alia before she tied the knot. "She makes you believe that it is all coming in very easily but she does her homework. I think her ease, her prep work [is incredible]," Sidharth added. The actor will next feature in 'Thank God'.

25.title: BJP shares parody video mocking Rahul, says ‘why doesn’t suffering end mommy?’
25.article_body: BJP on Sunday shared a parody video mocking Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Mommy, why doesn't this suffering end?" BJP tweeted, taking a jibe at Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi. The video touches upon several issues that Congress faced recently, including the resignation of leaders in J&K following Ghulam Nabi Azad.

26.title: Stuck for 4 yrs, Gurugram's master road to be completed in 3 months: GMDA
26.article_body: Gurugram's master road dividing Sectors 77,78 and 79 would be completed in the next three months, the Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority said. The project was allotted in 2018 but work got delayed on multiple occasions. A 3.35 km-long main carriageway of the road is being constructed which will benefit over 10,000 residents living in the above sectors, officials said.

27.title: Kiara never lets stardom or the noise around get to her: Sidharth
27.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said his 'Shershaah' co-star and rumoured girlfriend Kiara Advani "has great innocence" on screen and she "never lets the stardom or all the noise around get to her". "As to how she remains that simple girl is something that you can learn from her," he added. Sidharth will be next seen in Indra Kumar's 'Thank God'.

28.title: US soldiers testing Microsoft's goggles get nausea, headaches: Report
28.article_body: US soldiers testing Microsoft's new goggles for the Army suffered "mission-affecting physical impairments" including headaches and nausea, Bloomberg reported citing Pentagon's summary. One soldier reportedly said, "The devices would have gotten us killed." The defense department's testing director Nickolas Guertin said the system is "experiencing too many failures of essential functions".

29.title: There will be a few more upsets: Gibbs after SL's loss vs Namibia
29.article_body: Responding to a question on Twitter, ex-South Africa batter Herschelle Gibbs said there will be a "few more" upsets in the T20 World Cup 2022 following Sri Lanka's loss against Namibia. "Conditions in Australia...give everyone a real chance," added Gibbs in his tweet. Namibia posted a total of 163/7 with Sri Lanka bowled out for 108 in 19 overs.

30.title: There's not just SpaceX: US as startup seeks funding for Starlink in Ukraine
30.article_body: Pentagon's deputy press secretary Sabrina Singh confirmed being in touch with SpaceX after it sought funding for Starlink in Ukraine, adding, "There's not just SpaceX, there are other entities that we can...partner with when it comes to providing Ukraine with what they need on the battlefield." Earlier, SpaceX said it can no longer donate or fund Starlink terminals for Ukraine.

31.title: Rahul to vote at Bharat Jodo Yatra campsite in K’taka for Cong chief poll
31.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who is currently in Karnataka as part of Bharat Jodo Yatra, will be voting for Congress Presidential election from a campsite in Ballari along with 40 other delegates who are a part of the yatra, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said. The election for Congress party Presidential post is set to take place on Monday, October 17.

32.title: UP man kills wife & daughter, says, 'Child's face didn't match with his'
32.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly killing his 25-year-old wife and one-year-old daughter on suspicion of infidelity in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. The accused has reportedly confessed to the crime and said that "he suspected that his daughter did not belong to him as her face didn't match with his". According to police, the couple used to have frequent quarrels.

33.title: Special trains to run from Secunderabad during festive season
33.article_body: The South Central Railway (SCR) will run special trains from Secunderabad during the festive season. The special services include Secunderabad-Tirupati on October 19, Tirupati-Secunderabad on October 20, Secunderabad-Santragachi on October 21, Santragachi-Secunderabad on October 22 and Narsapur-Secunderabad on October 18. The trains will have 2AC, Sleeper and General Second Class coaches.

34.title: Nigerian students leave Gurugram university after fight with local students
34.article_body: A group of 50-60 Nigerian students at Gurugram's GD Goenka University have "temporarily" left their campus after some were allegedly thrashed and threatened by Indian students while playing football. Police have registered cross FIRs against each group of students for allegedly assaulting each other. Local people attacked international students with different weapons, reads one of the FIRs.

35.title: Govt to extend ₹35,000 crore to seven sectors in next PLI round: Report
35.article_body: According to an official, the government is planning to extend ₹35,000 crore Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme to seven different sectors with an aim to boost domestic manufacturing and create jobs. These sectors consist of five new sectors, toys, bicycles, leather & footwear, critical intermediates for chemicals and containers, and two existing sectors: IT hardware and pharma.

36.title: Ukraine's Kharkiv Art Museum to preserve art collection using NFTs
36.article_body: Kharkiv Art Museum (KAM) in Ukraine on October 13 said the Binance NFT market now stocks 15 works of art from the museum's Art without Borders collection. As stated in the official announcement, the earnings from the project will be used to support the museum's operations. The NFT collection will also "preserve the cultural heritage of Ukraine", the announcement added.

37.title: Congress no longer a reliable party: AIUDF leader Rafiqul Islam
37.article_body: AIUDF General Secretary Rafiqul Islam said that since the Congress is no longer reliable, his party is preparing to contest the 2024 Lok Sabha polls alone. "In the last Assembly polls, Congress' seats went up only because of AIUDF. Shortly after the elections, it ended the alliance with the AIUDF," said Islam.

38.title: 19-yr-old smashes beer bottle on policeman's head in Pune; arrested
38.article_body: A 19-year-old was arrested for smashing a beer bottle on a 52-year-old traffic policeman's head in Pune on Saturday night. The officer was trying to ease traffic near Pune's MM Chowk area when the accused approached him and started hurling abuses before hitting him with a beer bottle. The accused threatened those who tried to help the officer.

39.title: They have told the world today 'Nam' yaad rakhna: Sachin as Namibia beat SL
39.article_body: Reacting to 14th-ranked Namibia defeating Sri Lanka by 55 runs in T20 World Cup 2022 opener, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Namibia has told the cricketing world today 'Nam' yaad rakhna!" Meanwhile, Mpumelelo Mbangwa tweeted, "What a win for Namibia and what start to the ICC Men's T20 World Cup!" Namibia posted a total of 163/7 and dismissed Sri Lanka for 108.

40.title: A student asked me if it's bad to want to be rich, I said it's not a sin: Anil Agarwal
40.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Founder Anil Agarwal in a LinkedIn post revealed that he was recently asked by a student if it is a bad thing to want to be rich. "I told him, no...making money is not a sin, but once you get there...there is no harm in slowing down and giving a lift to those who are walking," Agarwal said.

41.title: It's beyond what we thought: Namibia's Frylinck after beating SL
41.article_body: Talking about Namibia's win against Sri Lanka in the first match of T20 World Cup 2022, Namibia all-rounder Jan Frylinck, who was named as the Player of the Match, said, "I'm...speechless at the moment." "What we've...achieved is above what we thought we could do," added Frylinck. Reacting to the win, Namibia captain Gerhard Erasmus stated, "It's been a historic day."

42.title: Over 10,000 illegal liquor bottles crushed by road roller in Delhi
42.article_body: The Excise Department of the Delhi government on Saturday destroyed over 10,000 bottles containing 5,516 litres of smuggled liquor, officials said. The liquor bottles were spread on concrete stretches and a road roller was used to crush them, they said. "Seizure of liquor smuggled into Delhi and its destruction is a routine exercise," a senior Excise department official said.

43.title: 29-year-old TV actress Vaishali Takkar found dead at her home in Indore
43.article_body: TV actress Vaishali Takkar has passed away at the age of 29. She was found hanging at her home in Madhya Pradesh's Indore and a suicide note was also recovered from the spot, according to reports. She has acted in several Hindi shows, including 'Sasural Simar Ka', 'Super Sisters' and 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' among others.

44.title: They forced me to accept I was someone else: Noida man detained in Abu Dhabi
44.article_body: A Noida-based man named Praveen Kumar, who returned to the city after being wrongfully detained at the Abu Dhabi airport, said, "They kept me overnight, forced me to accept I was someone else." He was detained after his face matched with a 'wanted criminal' in a face recognition software. He was let go after the intervention by Indian authorities.

45.title: Amit Shah launches Hindi version of MBBS course books in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal
45.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday launched the Hindi version of MBBS books in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. Anatomy, Physiology and Biochemistry have been chosen to be studied in Hindi as of now. "It is a big day. For the first time in the country, medical education in Hindi will begin in Madhya Pradesh," state Medical Education Minister Vishvas Sarang said.

46.title: Doesn't matter who wins, party should win: Tharoor on Cong chief poll
46.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor said it doesn't matter who wins the poll but the party should win. "Doesn't matter if Kharge sahab wins or I win. Congress should win as it's a party of inclusive India," Tharoor added. "We're the only party that wants everyone to be with us, irrespective of religion, gender, language, region...state," he stated.

47.title: Janhvi just started her journey, don't compare her & Sridevi: Boney
47.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor said people shouldn't draw comparisons between Janhvi and Sridevi's work as the former has "just started her journey" as an actor. He added that Janhvi "perhaps carries" Sridevi's DNA in terms of getting into the skin of her characters. "Which is why you've seen the growth she's done in the films so far," he said about Janhvi.

48.title: You're no Deepti: Ganesh on Starc taking her name while giving mankad warning
48.article_body: Talking about a video where Mitchell Starc gave a 'mankad' warning to Jos Buttler by saying, "I'm not Deepti, but I won't do it", ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh tweeted, "You are no Deepti Sharma." "You can never be Deepti," added Ganesh in his tweet. Ex-India cricketer Hemang Badani had earlier termed Starc's gesture as "really poor" in a tweet.

49.title: Man fakes kidnapping to extort family to buy car in Delhi; arrested
49.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly faking his kidnapping to extort money from his family in Delhi as he wanted to buy a car, police said. The accused called his family and told them that some people abducted him and were asking for a ransom of ₹2 lakh, according to police. The family has filed a case against the accused.

50.title: Xi Jinping says China will not renounce right to use force over Taiwan, it responds
50.article_body: China will never renounce the right to use force to resolve the Taiwan issue but will strive for a peaceful resolution, President Xi Jinping said on Sunday. "The complete reunification of the motherland must be achieved," he added. Taiwan responded by saying that it will not back down on its sovereignty or compromise on freedom and democracy.

51.title: We got a good team, it's about the process: Dasun after loss to Namibia
51.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation after their 55-run defeat against Namibia in the T20 World Cup, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said, "We didn't execute well with the ball. Didn't bowl in the right areas and that's a concern." He added, "We need not do anything special. We got a good team, it's about the process."

52.title: Ex-Punjab minister held for bribing officer to settle cases against him
52.article_body: Former minister Sunder Sham Arora has been arrested by the Punjab Vigilance Bureau for allegedly offering a bribe of ₹50 lakh to one of its officers to help him settle cases against him. Reports said that Arora has been facing inquiries in a disproportionate assets case and in connection with alleged irregularities during his tenure as Industries Minister.

53.title: Stopped playing lover boy 10 years ago, found it awkward: Prithviraj
53.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Prithviraj Sukumaran said he stopped playing the role of a lover boy 10 years ago as he "was finding it awkward to do that at 30". Calling 40 a "fantastic age" for him, Prithviraj added, "I no longer have to be scared about playing a role...If being younger on screen doesn't affect me, then being older shouldn't either."

54.title: 4 persons assault woman, 2 minor daughters in Hyderabad; booked
54.article_body: Hyderabad's Humayun Nagar police have booked four people, including three members of an organisation, for allegedly assaulting a woman and her two minor daughters. The woman claimed that the accused "beat with hands, tore...clothes and touched private parts". The incident occurred when the woman went to the organisation's office after one of the accused reportedly approached her minor daughter.

55.title: Traffic movement to be regulated on Delhi roads between Oct 18-21
55.article_body: The traffic movement in Delhi will be regulated from October 18 to 21 in view of the 90th Annual General Assembly of Interpol, which is going to take place in New Delhi's Pragati Maidan next week, an official said. Delegations from 195 countries will attend the event and PM Narendra Modi will be inaugurating the Assembly on October 18.

56.title: Actress Manava says Uber driver threatened her, said 'rukh tereko dikhata hoo'
56.article_body: Actress Manava Naik said that an Uber driver misbehaved with her following an argument over him jumping a signal during her ride in Mumbai. "Driver started threatening me.. 'rukh tereko dikhata hoo'. He then tried to stop the uber in a dark spot...I started yelling. 2 bike riders and 1 rickshaw guy cornered the Uber...and got me out," Naik tweeted.

57.title: Warner will definitely play vs NZ, not sure about warm-up vs India: Finch
57.article_body: Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch has said opener David Warner is unlikely to play against India in their warm-up match on Monday in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "I think Warner will definitely be right for New Zealand," added Finch. Warner suffered whiplash (a neck injury) in the second England T20I after he landed awkwardly while attempting a catch.

58.title: Basavaraj Bommai to visit Delhi to discuss cabinet expansion
58.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai confirmed that he will be going to the national capital to discuss cabinet expansion with BJP National President JP Nadda and other senior leaders. While talking to the media, the CM said that everyone will be informed when the high command gives permission for the cabinet expansion.

59.title: 12 shot dead as gunmen open fire in Mexico bar, 2nd mass shooting in less than 30 days
59.article_body: Unidentified gunmen opened fire in a bar in the central Mexican city of Irapuato on Saturday evening, shooting dead six women and six men, authorities said. Three people were injured in the attack. It is the second mass shooting in Guanajuato in less than a month as 10 people were shot dead at a bar in Tarimoro on September 21.

60.title: Looks like milk is competing with petrol when it comes to price rise: AAP MP
60.article_body: After Amul announced that it is increasing the prices of full cream milk and buffalo milk by ₹2 per litre, AAP MP Raghav Chadha said, "Looks like milk is competing with petrol when it comes to price rise and breaking the common man's back." Furthermore, he said, "Average Indian families continue to pay for the mistakes of an apathetic government."

61.title: Mumbai to get ₹6,322 crore twin tunnels for East-West connectivity
61.article_body: A 4.7-km-long twin tunnel will be built below Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP), with an extended tunnel passing through the Filmcity in Goregaon as a part of Goregaon Mulund Link Road (GMLR) project. The tunnel will be constructed at the cost of ₹6,322 crore and will connect Western Express Highway with Eastern Express Highway.

62.title: Russia giving Viagra to soldiers, using rape as 'strategy' in Ukraine: UN official
62.article_body: Russia is using rape and sexual assault as a "strategy" in Ukraine, a UN official said in an interview. "When you hear women testify about Russian soldiers equipped with Viagra, it's clearly a military strategy," said UN special representative on sexual violence in conflict, Pramila Patten. UN verified over 100 rape cases in Ukraine since the war began, she added.

63.title: TN police stops suspected human sacrifice, family says ritual was to ward off evil
63.article_body: Tamil Nadu police on Saturday stopped a family of six from performing a suspected human sacrifice at their residence in Tiruvannamalai district. The neighbours reportedly alerted the police after the family did not come out for around three days. The family was performing a ritual to ward off an evil spirit, the police said.

64.title: US, Canada send armoured vehicles to Haiti to fight criminals
64.article_body: US and Canada on Saturday delivered security equipment like tactical and armoured vehicles and supplies to Haiti, according to a joint statement. "This equipment will assist the [Haitian National Police] in their fight against criminal actors who're fomenting violence and disrupting the flow of...humanitarian assistance, hindering efforts to halt the spread of cholera," the joint statement said.

65.title: 14th-ranked Namibia defeat Sri Lanka in first match of T20 World Cup 2022
65.article_body: Namibia, who're the 14th-ranked team, defeated eighth-ranked Sri Lanka by 55 runs in the first match of T20 World Cup 2022 in Geelong. Batting first, Namibia posted a total of 163/7, their highest T20I total against a full-member ICC team. Sri Lanka were bowled out for 108. It's Namibia's first-ever victory against a full-member ICC side in T20 World Cup.

66.title: Akshay shares pic of article claiming he owns '₹260cr private jet'; says 'baseless lies'
66.article_body: Akshay Kumar on Sunday called out a news website for wrongly claiming that the actor owns a private jet worth ₹260 crore. "Liar, Liar...pants on fire...Well, some people have clearly not grown up, and I'm just not in a mood to let them get away with it. Write baseless lies about me, and I'll call it out," Akshay tweeted.

67.title: ICC releases list of all commentators at T20 World Cup 2022, 3 Indians included
67.article_body: The ICC has revealed the commentary team for the T20 World Cup 2022. The official commentary team includes three Indians: Harsha Bhogle, Ravi Shastri and Sunil Gavaskar. Further, Mel Jones, Isa Guha and Natalie Germanos are the female commentators in the group of 29 commentators named for the tournament.

68.title: Manish Sisodia summoned by CBI for questioning in Delhi excise policy case
68.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia has been summoned by CBI for questioning in Delhi excise policy case on October 17. Meanwhile, the Enforcement Directorate raided about 25 locations in national capital as part of its investigation in connection with the policy. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said excise policy that was disallowed in Delhi is doing wonders in Punjab.

69.title: Sidharth Malhotra, Ananya walk the ramp as showstoppers at Lakme Fashion Week
69.article_body: Sidharth Malhotra and Ananya Panday walked the ramp as showstoppers at the Lakme Fashion Week on Saturday. While Sidharth walked for designer Gaurav Gupta, Ananya Panday wore an embellished blazer dress to represent designer duo Pankaj & Nidhi's 'Solaris' collection. Talking about Gaurav, Sidharth said the designer "balances edgy and masculine aesthetics" with something that looks fashionable.

70.title: Got a call saying 'hope you die': CEO after US firm fires engineers for moonlighting
70.article_body: US-based software company Canopy's CEO Davis Bell said he fired two recently hired engineers for moonlighting. He also revealed that he later got a call from someone telling him they hope Bell dies in a car crash. "[The engineers] were following a new trend of picking up a second, full-time job while lying about it to both employers," Bell said.

71.title: Rupee not sliding, Dollar strengthening incessantly: Nirmala Sitharaman in US
71.article_body: Responding to a question on Rupee's performance in the US, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said she would look at it not as the Rupee sliding but as Dollar strengthening incessantly. She added, "It's a matter of fact India's Rupee probably has withstood this Dollar rate going up. I think Rupee has performed much better than many other emerging market currencies."

72.title: Govt wants to give Kashmir youth bottle of alcohol instead of job: Mufti
72.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti, while criticising the administration, said that the government wants to give the youth a bottle of alcohol instead of a job in Kashmir. Opening of liquor stores won't be allowed in Kashmir, voices will be raised against it, she stated. Earlier, the J&K administration approved the sale of beer at departmental stores in urban centres.

73.title: Factually incorrect: Pak PM on Biden's 'dangerous nation' remark
73.article_body: After US President Joe Biden called Pakistan "one of the most dangerous nations in the world", the country's PM Shehbaz Sharif said that the remark is "factually incorrect and misleading". He added that Pakistan has proved to be the "most responsible nuclear nation" over the past decades. Earlier, Pakistan had summoned the US ambassador over Biden's comment.

74.title: Duplicity allegation against PM insult to people of Bihar: Nityanand Rai
74.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai criticised JD(U) President Lalan Singh and said that his allegation of duplicity against PM Modi was an insult to 12 crore people of Bihar. He referred to the humble beginnings of PM Modi and said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will have to answer for Lalan Singh's statement.

75.title: US President grabs girl's shoulder, says 'No serious guys until you're 30'; video viral
75.article_body: After addressing a college in US, President Joe Biden gave dating advice to a girl, saying, "Now a very important thing I told my daughters and granddaughters- no serious guys until you're 30." The video of the exchange shows Biden getting a picture clicked with the girl before grabbing her shoulder and advising her.

76.title: 'Mili' has been one of the most challenging roles of my career: Janhvi
76.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor said her upcoming film 'Mili' has been "one of the most challenging roles" of her career. She said the film's director Mathukutty Xavier "brought out the very best" of her on screen. Talking about Janhvi, 'Mili' producer Boney Kapoor said she has performed "phenomenally well" in the film, which is the Hindi remake of the Malayalam film 'Helen'.

77.title: Sri Lanka will be a threat in this T20 World Cup: Gautam Gambhir
77.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir picked Dasun Shanaka-led Sri Lanka to be a threat in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Because of the kind of success they have had at the Asia Cup. The way they are playing...they're probably peaking at the right time," explained Gambhir. Sri Lanka won the 2022 Asia Cup after defeating Pakistan in the final last month.

78.title: Major fire at Manesar chemical factory, 15 fire tenders rushed to spot
78.article_body: A major fire broke out at a chemical manufacturing factory in Binola, Manesar on Saturday morning. Reports said that no injuries were reported in the incident since the factory was closed. Guards on duty at the factory alerted the police and fire department officials. Reports added that 15 fire tenders were rushed to the spot.

79.title: Trump pressured Truth Social exec to give his shares to Melania: Report
79.article_body: Former President Donald Trump pressured Truth Social Co-founder Andy Litinsky to give shares in the company to his wife, former First Lady Melania Trump, whistleblower Will Wilkerson has alleged. He added that Litinsky refused to do so and told Trump that "the gift would have meant a huge tax bill he couldn't pay". Litinsky was later fired after the incident.

80.title: NOCs not needed for sale of properties in regularised colonies of Gurugram: DTCP
80.article_body: The Department of Town and Country Planning (DTCP) issued directions that plot owners in regularised colonies of Gurugram are no longer required to obtain no-objection certificates (NOCs) from the department for the sale and purchase of properties. The decision comes after several property owners in the city complained of property registrations getting delayed due to the earlier mandate.

81.title: PM Modi dedicates 75 Digital Banking Units across 75 districts to the nation
81.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday dedicated 75 Digital Banking Units (DBUs) to the nation. The DBUs will be set up in 75 districts and will "further financial inclusion and enhance banking experience for citizens", PM said. They will provide a variety of digital banking facilities, including opening of savings account, funds transfer, investment in fixed deposits, and loan applications.

82.title: Hema Malini is a legend beyond the definitions of superstardom: Shatrughan
82.article_body: Actor-politician Shatrughan Sinha said that in today's day and age of instant success, Hema Malini "is a legend beyond the definitions of superstardom". Wishing the actress-politician on her 74th birthday, Shatrughan added, "Hema and Dharmendra have been my friends for years. It is rare for a friendship to survive so long in this industry where loyalties change every Friday."

83.title: India has the highest unemployment ever in 45 years: Rahul Gandhi
83.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised the Centre over unemployment and corruption in the country and said that joblessness is at its peak. "India has the highest unemployment ever in 45 years. The PM had said that he would provide employment to two crore youth every year. Where did those jobs go? Instead, crores of youth have become unemployed," said Rahul.

84.title: Someone other than Rohit should get role of increasing run-rate: Klusener
84.article_body: Ex-South Africa all-rounder Lance Klusener said India should assign the role of increasing run-rate in powerplay to someone other than Rohit Sharma. "There's no need for Rohit to go faster. He was playing easily fast enough, aggressive enough and well enough...not to have changed," Klusener added. India will open their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign against Pakistan on October 23.

85.title: It's all about muscle memory: Uthappa on Shami's lack of match practice
85.article_body: Ex-cricketer Robin Uthappa, on being asked if the lack of match practice will be a problem for pacer Mohammad Shami in the T20 World Cup, said, "Not necessarily." He added, "I think for someone with Shami's experience, it's about muscle memory." Notably, Shami hasn't played a T20I since the T20 World Cup last year.

86.title: Panasonic India announces new line-up of 'truly smart' washing machines
86.article_body: Panasonic India announced a new range of 'Smart Washing Machines' powered by Panasonic’s IoT platform Miraie, starting at ₹19,690. The wi-fi-enabled top-load washing machines are controllable via Miraie, Alexa and/or Google Assistant. They are equipped with Built-In Heater, Wash Wizard for custom recommendations and Stain Genius which gives consumers pre-treatment recommendations based on stains.

87.title: BJP living in denial: Kharge on India's global hunger ranking
87.article_body: After India’s rank on the Global Hunger Index (GHI) dropped to 107th position, Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge said "BJP is living in denial". "BJP…trying to suppress facts has led India to this massive crisis," Kharge added. "Are there any more excuses still left, [PM] Modi Ji?" Kharge asked. Meanwhile, Congress' P Chidambaram criticised the government over the latest GHI report.

88.title: Ghaziabad municipal corporation to ban registration of 3 dog breeds
88.article_body: The Ghaziabad municipal corporation passed a resolution to not allow registration of three breeds of dogs - Rottweilers, Dogo Argentinos and Pitbulls. The decision was taken by the board in the wake of several dog attack cases involving these three breeds, officials said. Anyone found keeping these dogs without registration will face a penalty of ₹5000, an official added.

89.title: Hardik will finish games like MS Dhoni used to: Raina on T20 World Cup 2022
89.article_body: Former India batter Suresh Raina said his "go-to man" for the T20 World Cup 2022 would be all-rounder Hardik Pandya. "Hardik will finish games like MS Dhoni did for a long period. He will control the game. He'll bowl the crucial overs," added Raina. Further, Raina termed Suryakumar Yadav as a batter whose angle and swing are "brilliant".

90.title: Man stabs transgender person, their partner in Delhi; partner dies
90.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly stabbed a transgender person and their partner in Delhi, police said. The transgender person and their partner were taken to hospital where the latter succumbed to his injuries while the former is in serious condition. The incident occurred after the accused apparently started a fight over ₹40,000 borrowed by the transgender person.

91.title: Priyanka reveals she doesn't follow Hasan on Instagram over Malala joke, calls him 'petty'
91.article_body: Priyanka Chopra has shared a screenshot revealing she doesn't follow back Hasan Minhaj on Instagram and called him "petty over funny" backing Malala Yousafzai. Minhaj had joked he doesn't follow back Malala on Instagram after which the Nobel Peace Prize Winner also unfollowed him. Minhaj later shared a reel pretending to be upset and asked Malala to follow him again.

92.title: Trying my hardest to de-escalate it and failing: Musk on Ukraine-Russia situation
92.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said he's trying his "hardest to de-escalate" Ukraine-Russia situation and "obviously failing". His response came to a Twitter user accusing him of continuing support for "US proxy war" in Ukraine after Musk said SpaceX will provide Starlink in Ukraine despite losing money. "Damned if you do, damned if you don't, so...I'm just damned," Musk wrote.

93.title: Did many films with Dharmendra, but 'Sholay' remains special: Hema Malini
93.article_body: Hema Malini said she has done a lot of films with actor-husband Dharmendra, but "'Sholay' remains special". The actress tagged 'Sholay' as her "most famous film". When asked if she'd like to work with Dharmendra again, Hema said she'd like to if they were offered "something like what Meryl Streep and Clint Eastwood did in 'The Bridges Of Madison County'".

94.title: Terrorists will be turned to dust: J&K BJP chief on killing of Kashmiri Pandit
94.article_body: Reacting to the killing of Puran Krishan Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit, in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district, J&K's BJP chief Ravinder Raina said those who conspired to target Puran will have to bear the brunt. "The Army-Police have put up check nakas, and the conspiring terrorists will be turned to dust," he added. Puran was shot dead near his residence.

95.title: Duo cheats people of ₹6 cr on pretext of investment in Hyd; held
95.article_body: Two persons were arrested on Saturday for allegedly cheating over 25 people to the tune of ₹6 crore on the pretext of investment in film distribution in Hyderabad. According to a police officer, the accused had cheated the people by promising them good profits but they reportedly didn't return the principal amount nor did they pay the profits collected.

96.title: India's 19-year-old Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi defeats world number one Magnus Carlsen
96.article_body: India's 19-year-old Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the seventh round of Airchess Rapid. This is the first time that Erigaisi defeated Carlsen in his chess career. Arjun is currently placed fifth on the tournament's points table with 15 points, having won a total of four matches so far.

97.title: Chhattisgarh Assembly Deputy Speaker Manoj Singh dies of heart attack at 58
97.article_body: Chhattisgarh Assembly Deputy Speaker Manoj Singh Mandavi passed away after suffering a heart attack at age of 58 on Sunday. Reports said that Mandavi was taken to hospital in Dhamtari town. Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel condoled his demise and called it an "irreparable loss". Mandavi's last rites will be performed in Nathiya Nawagaon in Kanker, news agency ANI reported.

98.title: India reports 2,401 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,625
98.article_body: India reported 2,401 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 2,373 people recovered in the last 24 hours, following which active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 26,625. The recovery rate in the country currently stands at 98.76%, while the daily positivity rate is at 1.04%.

99.title: Mamata Banerjee befooling people of West Bengal: Suvendu Adhikari
99.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari wrote a letter to Union Minister Piyush Goyal and claimed that West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is befooling people by renaming Centre's already launched schemes. "The Khadya Sathi scheme is another infamous sticker scheme of the Mamata Banerjee government...It is nothing but a label placed on the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana," wrote Adhikari.

100.title: Incorporate feminist thinking in way you deal with law: SC judge to students
100.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud on Saturday advised young law students to incorporate feminist thinking in the way they dealt with law. While addressing the convocation of the National Law University (NLU), Delhi, Justice Chandrachud said, "You must strive to make the legal system more inclusive and accessible when you become a part of it.

101.title: US Prez Biden calls UK PM Truss' tax cut plan a 'mistake'
101.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that it's "predictable" that UK PM Liz Truss had to drop a tax-cutting plan, adding, "I wasn't...only one that thought it was a mistake."  "I disagreed with...policy, but that's up to Great Britain to make that judgment," he further said. Earlier, UK's new Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt also called the tax cuts "mistakes".

102.title: Google manager held hostage, forcibly married to a girl by her family in MP
102.article_body: A man working as a senior manager at Google in Bengaluru has alleged he was taken hostage in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal and forcibly married to a girl whom he had met while pursuing MBA. He told the police he was forcibly given intoxicants to marry her, following which her family members clicked some photographs and demanded ₹40 lakh from him.

103.title: Cong youngsters with me, seniors backing Kharge: Tharoor on Cong chief poll
103.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Saturday said youngsters and people in lower levels of the party are supporting him, while seniors are backing Mallikarjun Kharge. "We've been talking about change and older people resist it," Tharoor added. It would be foolish on the part of any Congress President to distance himself from the Gandhis, he stated.

104.title: 65-yr-old man beaten up by drunk men on grandson's bday dies in Punjab
104.article_body: A 65-year-old man, who was reportedly beaten up by drunk men who barged into his house during the birthday celebrations of his grandson, died days after incident. The incident took place on October 4. Police have arrested four men in connection with the case. Those arrested were part of a group of 15 men who had barged into victim's house.

105.title: Peon demands sexual favour from pregnant woman in Mumbai, her husband stabs him
105.article_body: Husband of an eight-month pregnant Asha worker was arrested by Mumbai Police after he attacked a man who allegedly tried to demand sexual favours from his wife. The victim, a bank peon by profession, approached the woman for her number. Assuming that he had some health department related work, she shared her number and later received calls demanding sexual favour.

106.title: 'Uunchai' is probably the most fulfilling experience of my career: Boman
106.article_body: Actor Boman Irani said his upcoming film 'Uunchai' is "probably the most fulfilling experience" of his acting career. "This is a very emotional film for me and this experience is beyond my words. I will cherish this for as long as I live," he said. Boman added that people who believe in goodness and relationships will love the film.

107.title: Bus overturns on highway in Colombia leaving 20 dead, 15 injured
107.article_body: At least 20 people were killed and 15 others were injured after a bus overturned on a highway in southwestern Colombia, police said. It reportedly took nine hours to set bus upright, evacuate the injured and recover the deceased's bodies. As per a preliminary report, the bus driver lost control after coming out of a curve in a foggy area.

108.title: 4 women from same family fall into river while taking selfie in Maha; 2 die
108.article_body: Two sisters died while two others from the same family were rescued after they slipped and fell into Vaitarna river while a taking selfie in Maharashtra's Virar on Saturday. The deceased were identified as 15-year-old Santu Dasan and her 24-year-old sister Neela. Locals along with railway workers rescued the other two women using ropes.

109.title: Figment of imagination: Capitalmind CEO on viral post on UPI 'killing' toffee business
109.article_body: A LinkedIn post claiming that UPI is "killing" the candy business has gone viral. Drawing a link between candy makers losing revenue and the rise of UPI, GrowthX Founder Abhishek Patil said shopkeepers would "trade toffees for loose cash" earlier, but this stopped with UPI. Capitalmind CEO Deepak Shenoy refuted Patil's claim, saying it "seems like a figment of imagination".

110.title: Fire breaks out at Iran's infamous prison amid anti-hijab protests, shots heard
110.article_body: A fire broke out in Tehran's Evin prison, where many of Iran's political and dual-national detainees are held, on Saturday night and witnesses reported hearing gunfire. State news agency IRNA said eight people were injured in the unrest, which erupted after nearly a month of protests across Iran over the death in detention of Mahsa Amini, a 22-year-old woman.

111.title: Layoffs are withdrawal symptoms of founders on steroids: Ronnie Screwvala
111.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad's Co-founder Ronnie Screwvala told ET NOW in an interview, "Layoffs are unfortunately withdrawal symptoms of founders being on steroids." He said that a company's expansion beyond its scope can also lead to layoffs. Screwvala's comments come soon after BYJU'S said it will lay off 5% of its 50,000 workforce over the next six months.

112.title: Huge crowds at bus, railway stations in UP as candidates return from UP PET exam
112.article_body: Huge crowd of passengers were found thronging several bus depots and railway stations of Uttar Pradesh on Saturday evening as candidates, who appeared for UPSSSC Preliminary Eligibility Test (PET) 2022, returned from their exam centres. Huge rush was reported from Kanpur Central, Ghazipur and Sitapur railway stations. The prelims of the two-tier examination will conclude today.

113.title: Mumbai firm's CEO cheated of ₹9.78 lakh after being promised elite club card
113.article_body: A 73-year-old Chief Executive Officer of a private firm in Mumbai was cheated of ₹9.78 lakh after he was promised a Diners Club International credit card by fraudster, reports said. The victim was sent a link to fill in all his information. The fraudster even sent his accomplice with an android phone for the CEO to download a mobile application.

114.title: Tejashwi Yadav will become Bihar CM in few months: RJD MLA
114.article_body: RJD MLA Izhar Asfi on Saturday claimed that Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav will soon become the new CM of Bihar. "The people of Bihar want it and I think most of the leaders of the state are ready for it...maybe it will take a month or two but Tejashwi Yadav will indeed become the CM of Bihar," Asfi stated.

115.title: Pune Police arrest 8 in connection with alleged murder attempt
115.article_body: Pune Police arrested eight people for allegedly attempting to kill the complainant, Rohit Khate, from the Dattawadi area due to old enmity. Khate informed the police that around 10 people barged into his apartment on Thursday night with weapons. The police laid a trap and nabbed the accused, including two minors. According to police, most of the accused are history-sheeters.

116.title: Falling in Champions League is sad, but El Clasico is great opportunity: Xavi
116.article_body: With Barcelona facing elimination in the ongoing Champions League, their manager Xavi has said El Clasico against Real Madrid on Sunday is a great opportunity for them to recover and regain confidence. "We're the (La Liga) leaders and we want to continue to be as of Sunday," he added. Barcelona have won seven of their eight games in La Liga.

117.title: Salman Khan's 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan' to release on Eid 2023
117.article_body: Salman Khan announced that his film 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan' will now release on Eid 2023. The news came after he shared that 'Tiger 3' has been postponed and will now release on Diwali 2023. 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan', which will also feature Pooja Hegde and Shehnaaz Gill, was earlier expected to release in December 2022.

118.title: Mother Dairy hikes prices of full cream, cow milk by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR from today
118.article_body: Mother Dairy has hiked prices of full cream milk and cow milk by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR with effect from today. This is the third time that the prices of Mother Dairy milk have been hiked in Delhi-NCR this year. Mother Dairy had earlier increased milk prices by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR in March and mid-August.

119.title: Bengaluru-Mysuru highway flooded due to heavy rain
119.article_body: Parts of the Bengaluru–Mysuru highway were flooded after a lake near Mandya overflowed due to heavy rainfall in the city on Friday night. The Bengaluru Traffic Police asked the commuters to use an alternative route. "People who are travelling to Mysuru are advised to use Bengaluru – Nagamangala – Pandavapura – Srirangapattana – Mysuru road," the traffic police said.

120.title: 16-year-old boy falls from multi-level parking, dies in Noida
120.article_body: A 16-year-old boy died after he allegedly fell off the fencing of a multi-level parking in Noida's Sector-18, police said on Saturday. Preliminary investigations revealed that the boy was trying to make a video while attempting to get on top of the fencing, according to police. "The boy was found with a...phone in his hand," DCP (Noida) Harish Chander said.

121.title: 9 people killed after tempo collides with milk vehicle in Karnataka
121.article_body: Nine people were killed after a tempo traveller collided with a KMF milk vehicle in Karnataka's Hassan. Police said that the victims were returning home after visiting Dharmasthala, Subramanya and Hasanamba temples. The deceased include a two-year-old child and three children aged 10, 10 and 12. The deceased also include 50-year-old Leelavati, 33-year-old Chaitra and 20-year-old Vandana.

122.title: In 1 or 2 games, you could see Pant playing again: Suresh Raina
122.article_body: Former India batter Suresh Raina has said wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is an "X-factor" and will be getting a few games in the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "Pant has done it (made runs previously) in Australia...[and] if you see from 1-6, there's no leftie batter...So, in one or two games, you could see him playing again," explained Raina.

123.title: Egyptian national smuggling ₹41.86 lakh-gold held at Hyd airport
123.article_body: An Egyptian national who was allegedly smuggling gold worth ₹41.86 lakh in the form of a chain and bangles was arrested at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport on Saturday. The gold, weighing 802 gm, was seized after it was found during personal and baggage search of the passengers, Hyderabad Customs tweeted. The accused had arrived in Hyderabad from Kuwait.

124.title: Great Brutal Britain: Mahindra as UK newspaper asks 'Can Liz Truss outlast lettuce?'
124.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra reacted to reports of a British newspaper challenging UK Prime Minister Liz Truss to outlast a head of iceberg lettuce. The tabloid started a livestream on YouTube with an unrefrigerated lettuce next to a photo of Truss and asked, "Can Liz Truss outlast a lettuce?" Responding to a tweet about the livestream, Mahindra wrote, "Great (Brutal) Britain."

125.title: I'll do films which are progressive & have a moral: Ayushmann
125.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana said he wants to do films that "are progressive" and "have a moral". Calling such films his "USP", the actor said he doesn't want to do films that are regressive in nature. "I know, the popular palate is slightly regressive, but I can't change my mindset like that," Ayushmann said, adding that he believes in cinema for change.

126.title: Mumbai local train services to be hit today due to mega block
126.article_body: Mumbai local train services will remain hit on Sunday as Central Railway (Mumbai division) will carry out a mega block on its suburban sections for various engineering and maintenance works. Due to the mega block, local trains leaving and arriving at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) from 11.00 am to 5.00 pm will reach their destination 15 minutes behind schedule.

127.title: Full control over Hong Kong achieved, determined on Taiwan: Xi Jinping
127.article_body: China has achieved comprehensive control over Hong Kong, turning it from chaos to governance, Chinese President Xi Jinping said in a speech on Sunday at the opening of the once-in-five-year Communist Party congress in Beijing. China has also waged a major struggle against Taiwan separatism and is determined and able to oppose territorial integrity, Xi said.

128.title: Resident & security guard slap, punch each other in Ghaziabad; incident caught on CCTV
128.article_body: A CCTV footage showing a resident and a security guard of a housing society slapping and punching each other in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad has surfaced online. The guard had reportedly stopped the man and asked him where he was going, following which the man slapped the guard. Police said a case has been registered in connection with the case.

129.title: 2 gunmen open fire during target practice at Russian military ground, kill 11 soldiers
129.article_body: At least 11 Russian soldiers have been killed and over 15 wounded after two gunmen opened fire on a group of volunteers during a target practice session at a military ground in the western part of the country. The Russian Defence Ministry said the two gunmen had been shot dead after the attack. The ministry called it a terrorist attack.

130.title: Up to 85% off across brands + 250 NeuCoins on your 1st order: Tata Neu
130.article_body: Shop at The Grand Sale by Tata Neu with great deals on fashion, electronics, groceries, food orders, hotel stays, personal loans, medicines, flights and in-flight meals, said the brand. Get 10% instant discount/cashback with ICICI Bank credit cards from 19th to 21st October and 5% NeuCoins on every purchase only on Tata Neu, they added.

131.title: The hell with it, we'll keep funding Ukraine govt despite Starlink losing money: Musk
131.article_body: A day after saying SpaceX cannot indefinitely fund its Starlink service in Ukraine, billionaire Elon Musk on Saturday said it will continue to do the same. "The hell with it...even though Starlink is still losing money and other companies are getting billions of taxpayer dollars, we'll just keep funding Ukraine govt for free," tweeted Musk.

132.title: French delegation to check workers' conditions in Qatar ahead of WC
132.article_body: The French Football Federation (FFF) said it will send a delegation to Qatar to conduct checks on the working conditions of migrant workers ahead of the 2022 FIFA World Cup. The move comes after a documentary revealed poor living conditions at the team's World Cup base in Doha. FFF President Noel Le Graet earlier played down the documentary's revelations.

133.title: Nikola Founder Trevor Milton found guilty of fraud over misleading statements
133.article_body: Trevor Milton, Founder and former CEO of electric truck maker Nikola, was found guilty of three of four counts of fraud relating to false statements about Nikola's stock in a US federal court. Milton was accused of "repeatedly disseminating false and misleading information...through social media". He could face up to 25 years in prison if convicted on all four counts.

134.title: Goalkeeper Sa playing with a broken wrist since Aug: Wolves manager
134.article_body: Wolverhampton Wanderers manager Steve Davis said club goalkeeper Jose Sa has been playing with a broken wrist since August. "For him to do that and get on with it shows the courage he has got. It shows his character," said Davis. Sa sustained the injury during Wolves' second game of the season against Fulham in which he saved a penalty.

135.title: Outgoing BCCI President Ganguly to contest for CAB President post
135.article_body: After being denied the opportunity to be the BCCI President for a second term, former India captain Sourav Ganguly will contest for the post of Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) President. The CAB polls are scheduled to be held on October 31. Ganguly was reportedly offered the post of IPL Chairman, which he declined.

136.title: DMK warns of protest in Delhi if Hindi is imposed in Tamil Nadu
136.article_body: DMK MLA and Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin's son, Udhayanidhi Stalin, has warned that the party would stage a protest against the BJP-led Centre in Delhi if Hindi is imposed in Tamil Nadu. DMK protested in Tamil Nadu over the matter on Saturday. The opposition to Hindi imposition wouldn't end with a day's protest and by raising slogans, Udhayanidhi said.

137.title: S Jaishankar discusses Ukraine war with Egyptian Foreign Minister
137.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar discussed the Ukraine war, developments in the Indo-Pacific and other regional topics with his Egyptian counterpart Sameh Shoukry in Cairo on Saturday. Jaishankar is on a two-day visit to Egypt at the invitation of Shoukry. "A warm and productive meeting with FM Sameh Shoukry...as we mark 75 years of diplomatic relations this year," Jaishankar tweeted.

138.title: Drunk cousin rapes, kills 16-year-old girl in Rajasthan; arrested
138.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was allegedly raped and killed by her drunk cousin in Rajasthan's Meghasar village. The accused, a farm worker from Punjab's Kabarwala, has been arrested in connection with the crime. As per reports, he strangled the girl when she resisted his attempts. The minor's body was found buried in the sand near railway tracks in Rajasthan.

139.title: Woman, her 2 children attacked by their pet pitbull in Haryana
139.article_body: A woman and her two children were attacked and injured by their pet pitbull dog in Baliar Khurd village of Haryana's Rewari district on Friday, PTI reported. The woman received 50 stitches on her leg, hand and head, according to her family. The two children were reportedly discharged from the hospital on Saturday.

140.title: Lankan govt to use Indian credit line to install solar panels
140.article_body: Sri Lanka's Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera on Saturday said a credit line of $100 million extended by India will be used to install rooftop solar panels in government buildings, educational institutions and hospitals. The decision comes amidst widespread protests over high power tariffs in the country. Sri Lanka raised its electricity tariff by an average of 75% this August.

141.title: Delhi logs 135 COVID-19 cases, no deaths in last 24 hours
141.article_body: Delhi recorded 135 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 2.12% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Saturday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 465, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi's total case tally has climbed to 20,04,787.

142.title: Who is the highest run-getter and highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup history?
142.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena is the highest run-scorer in T20 World Cup history. He scored 1,016 runs in 31 T20 World Cup innings. He's followed by Chris Gayle (965 runs) and Tillakaratne Dilshan (897 runs). Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan is the highest wicket-taker in the tournament history with 41 scalps. He is followed by Shahid Afridi (39 wickets).

143.title: Pak summons US envoy as Prez Biden calls it 'one of world's most dangerous nations'
143.article_body: Pakistan has summoned the US ambassador after President Joe Biden called it "one of the most dangerous nations in the world", Pakistani Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari said. He further said he was surprised by Biden's remarks, adding, "Pakistan's nuclear assets...meet all- each and every- international standard in accordance with the IAEA."

144.title: More downforce at lower drag to be competitive in 2023: Mercedes F1
144.article_body: Mercedes F1 have said their 2023 car needs to have "more downforce at the lower drag level" to be competitive. The team had likened the current car to an "onion" that revealed new issues every time they improved something. After solving the 'porpoising' issue, Mercedes reportedly found that their car was 8-10 kph slower than Red Bull on the straights.

145.title: Odisha govt to abolish contractual hirings, 57,000 employees to benefit
145.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Saturday said the system of contractual hirings will be abolished and that the services of over 57,000 contract employees will be regularised. He said this decision will cost the government ₹1,300 crore annually. "This decision brings early Diwali for their (contract employees) family members," he said.

146.title: Russian strike damages energy facility in Ukraine's capital region
146.article_body: A key energy facility in Ukraine's capital region suffered serious damages in a Russian missile strike, the country's grid operator said on Saturday. No one was injured or killed as a result of the strike on the unidentified facility, the Kyiv region's governor said. Electricity transmission company Ukrenergo said efforts to restore the power supply were underway.

147.title: Satellite pic shows nuclear bombers deployed by Russia near NATO border
147.article_body: Satellite images from an independent Norwegian fact-checking website have shown that Russia has deployed 11 nuclear-capable long-range bombers at an airbase close to neighbouring Norway, which is a NATO member. Seven Tu-160s and four Tu-95 planes have reportedly been parked at the Olenya Air Base, as per pictures released by Faktisk.no. The number of Tu-160s parked there has steadily increased.

148.title: There's a real calmness, confidence in our team: Aaron Finch
148.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that there is calmness among the team members ahead of the T20 World Cup. "It would have been nice to win against England but it's not the be-all and end-all...There's a real...confidence that we know our best is good enough on the day," Finch said. Notably, Australia lost the T20I series to England by 2-0.

149.title: Eradicating corruption is Haryana govt's utmost priority: CM Khattar
149.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Saturday said eradicating corruption is his government's utmost priority. "Concrete steps have been taken in this direction," Khattar said. Speaking at a function in Haryana's Nayagaon, Khattar said he has made power a means to serve people and dedicated efforts are being made to raise the living standard of the poor through government schemes.

150.title: UP policemen who killed my wife were drunk: BJP leader Gurtaj Singh
150.article_body: BJP leader Gurtaj Singh has alleged that Uttar Pradesh Police officials who barged into his home and shot his wife dead in Uttarakhand on Friday were drunk. Gurpreet Kaur was killed while officials were chasing a criminal. Singh said, "[Police] are spreading propaganda that they were kept hostage." He added, "I'm...a public representative of the government, yet...this happened to me."

151.title: PCB appoints dedicated physio for Shaheen, Fakhar for T20 WC: Reports
151.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has reportedly appointed a dedicated physiotherapist for bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi and batter Fakhar Zaman during the T20 World Cup in Australia. Due to the kind of injuries suffered by the duo, PCB reportedly asked London-based physiotherapist, Dr Javed Akhtar Mughal, to join the squad. Dr Mughal worked with the players during their recent rehabilitation.

152.title: ED attaches properties worth ₹1,317 crore of Ireo Group
152.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached properties worth around ₹1,317 crore linked to the Ireo Group. The senior management of the group is alleged to have siphoned off ₹1,225 crore of funds belonging to homebuyers. The attached properties include residential premises, commercial spaces, bank accounts belonging to the company and its chairman Lalit Goyal.

153.title: 'Mirzapur' fame actor Jitendra Shastri passes away
153.article_body: Actor Jitendra Shastri, who was known for playing the role of Usmaan in the Ali Fazal and Pankaj Tripathi-led web series 'Mirzapur', has passed away. Actor Sanjay Mishra took to social media to share the news. Actor Rajesh Tailang, while mourning his demise, tweeted "Can't believe Jitu Bhai is no more, what an amazing actor, what a wonderful human being."

154.title: They've shown outstanding skill, teamwork: PM on India's Women's Asia Cup win
154.article_body: PM Narendra Modi congratulated India following their record-extending seventh Women's Asia Cup title on Saturday. "Our women's cricket team makes us proud with their grit and dexterity!...They have shown outstanding skill and teamwork," tweeted PM Modi. BCCI Secretary Jay Shah took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations to Harmanpreet Kaur and her team for raising the bar in women's cricket."

155.title: 21-yr-old Man Utd footballer Greenwood charged with attempted rape, controlling behaviour
155.article_body: Manchester United's 21-year-old footballer Mason Greenwood has been charged with attempted rape, engaging in controlling behaviour and assault. He was initially arrested in January after social media images and videos were posted by a woman reporting incidents of physical violence. He has been suspended by United pending investigation. The alleged rape is said to have occurred on October 22, 2021.

156.title: Was obsessed with Sridevi, I used to imitate her: Shefali Shah
156.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said in an interview that earlier she was obsessed with late actress Sridevi. "I was also told that I looked like her and then slowly I started imitating her," she added. "Thankfully, wisdom came knocking one day and I was like what am I doing? There can't be another Sridevi, so stop it," Shefali further said.

157.title: Bhuvneshwar is still the go-to guy for Rohit Sharma: Suresh Raina
157.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer Suresh Raina said that seamer Bhuvneshwar Kumar is still the go-to guy for skipper Rohit Sharma. "Bhuvneshwar is an experienced bowler...Sometimes you go for runs, but he still has that swing," Raina said. He added, "When Virat [Kohli] scored a hundred, [Bhuvneshwar] also took five wickets against Afghanistan...He has that knuckleball, swing and he hits areas well."

158.title: 18-yr-old NEET aspirant dies of liver disease in Raj, 35 other students ill
158.article_body: An 18-year-old NEET aspirant, who was diagnosed with severe liver disease, died during treatment at a private hospital in Rajasthan's Kota, an official said on Saturday. The victim was among 36 students, who were suffering from the disease. Kota CMHO said three water suppliers in the area were found to be supplying contaminated drinking water to coaching institutes and canteens.

159.title: Just stuck to basics and got rewards: Renuka on 3/5 in Asia Cup final
159.article_body: India pacer Renuka Singh said she's happy to be named 'Player of the Match' in India's eight-wicket win against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup 2022 final. Renuka posted bowling figures of 3-1-5-3. "In...last few games, I didn't bowl well. I practised with my coach...staff and got better. I didn't try anything, just stuck to...basics and got rewards," she added.

160.title: Waited for 12-14 hrs for Kareena during my debut film's shoot: Tusshar
160.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor, speaking on the insider versus outsider debate, said that a "red carpet" is not laid out for every star kid. "While shooting for my debut film, 'Mujhe Kucch Kehna Hai', I'd to wait for...co-star and another star kid Kareena Kapoor...for 12-14 hours as she was simultaneously working on four films," he said, adding he considers himself an outsider.

161.title: Immediately starting work on gas hub proposed by Russia: Turkey
161.article_body: Turkish and Russian officials have been told to immediately start technical work on a proposed natural gas hub in Turkey, President Recep Erdogan has said. Russian President Vladimir Putin had earlier proposed that this hub could sell gas "to third countries, especially in Europe". The proposal aims to export more gas through the TurkStream gas pipeline.

162.title: Video shows UP policeman stealing bulb from shop; suspended
162.article_body: Sub-inspector Rajesh Verma from Uttar Pradesh Police was suspended after a video of him stealing a bulb from outside a shop went viral. The video shows Verma discreetly looking around before removing the bulb. He then puts it in his pocket and walks away. Defending himself, Verma said he removed the bulb as it was dark where he was stationed.

163.title: 5 drug peddlers booked under PSA in J&K's Budgam district
163.article_body: Five alleged drug peddlers were booked under the Public Safety Act (PSA) in J&K's Budgam district, police said on Saturday. The PSA was invoked against the accused after obtaining sanctions from the competent authority, as per the police. The accused were involved in 12 cases registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act across central Kashmir, police added.

164.title: Kashmir Freedom Fighters claims responsibility for killing Kashmiri Pandit in J&K
164.article_body: Hours after Puran Krishan Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit, died after being shot in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Saturday, terror outfit Kashmir Freedom Fighters has claimed responsibility for the killing, police said. Bhat was on his way to an orchard in Chowdari Gund when he was fired upon. Police said they are ascertaining the reason behind the killing.

165.title: Mistakes were made: New UK Finance Minister on recent tax cuts
165.article_body: UK's new Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt on Saturday said his predecessor had made some "mistakes", referring to the tax cuts announced last month. "We will have some very difficult decisions ahead," Hunt said. His predecessor Kwasi Kwarteng was sacked by Prime Minister Liz Truss on Friday, after less than six weeks on the job.

166.title: Illegal property of 2 drug peddlers demolished in Haryana's Fatehabad
166.article_body: The district authorities on Saturday demolished an illegally built house of two drug peddler brothers in Haryana's Fatehabad. "Both the brothers were booked in 14 cases under...NDPS Act," Jakhal Police Station SHO Jai Bhagwan said. "One week ago, the municipal committee officials had served notice to the family of these peddlers asking them to vacate the house," SHO added.

167.title: Which are the best & worst-performing countries as per latest global hunger rankings?
167.article_body: Seventeen countries have shared the top rank in the Global Hunger Index 2022, including China, Belarus, Turkey, Chile, Croatia, Estonia, Hungary and Kuwait. These countries got a score of less than five on the index. Among the worst-performing nations is Yemen (ranked last at 121st position) followed by the Central African Republic, Madagascar, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Chad etc.

168.title: 2 killed in road accident in Jharkhand's Dumka district
168.article_body: Two people were killed following a collision between a motorcycle and a truck carrying stone chips in Jharkhand's Dumka district on Saturday, police said. Another person was critically injured in the accident that took place on a stretch of the Dumka-Rampurhat national highway near Simluti village, police added. The deceased include a man and a woman, as per a doctor.

169.title: Woman sedated at house party, gang-raped by guests in Pune
169.article_body: A woman, who had arranged a house party at her residence in Pune on October 9, was reportedly gang-raped by her guests. The woman claimed that after the party, she went to her room to rest, following which the accused entered the room, sprayed sedatives on her and raped her. Police have arrested two persons in the case.

170.title: Wasim Jaffer shares 'Kota Factory' meme to react to Rohit, Babar hugging each other
170.article_body: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to react to pictures of Team India captain Rohit Sharma and Pakistan captain Babar Azam hugging each other during a photoshoot ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. Reacting to the picture, he shared a meme from the first season of 'Kota Factory', which read, "Kitna parivarik mahol hai (What a familial atmosphere)."

171.title: I am going to 'mankad' someone next year: Rajasthan Royals' Riyan Parag
171.article_body: Rajasthan Royals all-rounder Riyan Parag took to Twitter and stated that he's going to "mankad" someone next year, adding, "It is going to create a fun Twitter debate." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "What if you don't get a chance to be in playing XI?" Parag responded, "Some positivity please...sir." "Ashwin will definitely support you," a fan wrote.

172.title: Wasn't able to perform my duties: Boora Narsaiah Goud after quitting TRS
172.article_body: Former TRS MP Boora Narsaiah Goud, after resigning from the party, alleged that he was not able to perform his duties and was not consulted on the decision to start Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS). "I didn't criticise the CM in my resignation letter," Goud said. "I've been through a lot of pain while separating from this family (TRS)," he added.

173.title: Really poor from you: Badani on Starc taking Deepti's name while giving 'mankad' warning
173.article_body: Reacting to a video of Australia pacer Mitchell Starc giving 'mankad' warning to England's Jos Buttler by saying, "I'm not Deepti, but I won't do it",  ex-India cricketer Hemang Badani tweeted, "Grow up Starc...That's really poor from you." He added, "If you only want to warn...non-striker...that's fine...but you bringing Deepti into this isn't what the cricket world expects of you."
