348.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation's (ISRO) heaviest rocket, LVM3, will launch 36 broadband satellites of the British startup OneWeb in LVM3 – M2/OneWeb India-1 Mission on October 23. The mission, which will be launched from spaceport in Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota, will make LVM3 enter the global commercial launch service market. India's Bharti Enterprises is a major investor in OneWeb.

349.title: India drops to 107th rank in Global Hunger Index 2022, behind Pakistan & Bangladesh
349.article_body: India has slipped six places on Global Hunger Index 2022 to take 107th position out of 121 countries ranked. With a score of 29.1, the index's publishers Concern Worldwide and Welthungerhilfe have labelled the level of hunger in India as "serious". Meanwhile, Pakistan (99), Sri Lanka (64), Bangladesh (84), Nepal (81) and Myanmar (71) have been ranked above India.

350.title: I already have my XI for Pakistan match: Rohit Sharma on T20 World Cup 2022 clash
350.article_body: During the pre-T20 World Cup 2022 press conference, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said that he already has his XI for the match against Pakistan, which will take place on October 23. "I don't believe in last-minute decisions," Rohit said, adding that the players have also been informed about the playing XI.

351.title: Pics of Rohit Sharma, Babar Azam from T20 World Cup 2022 photoshoot go viral
351.article_body: Pictures of Team India captain Rohit Sharma and Pakistan captain Babar Azam posing together in a photoshoot ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 have gone viral. India will face Pakistan in their first match of the 16-team tournament on October 23. The match will take place at Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).

352.title: 21-yr-old wanting escort job loses ₹76,500 to fraudster in Mumbai
352.article_body: A 21-year-old man who wanted to work as a male escort was conned by a fraudster into losing ₹76,500 on the pretext of paying various taxes and charges to join the services in Mumbai. According to police, the complainant works for a car wash company in Chembur. Due to less income, he began looking for alternate options to earn money.

353.title: Indian man serves free food in Ukraine, says 'Made good money here, now we're spending'
353.article_body: An Indian man is serving free meals to hundreds of people daily in Ukraine amid war. "We have made good money here, in Ukraine, so we are now spending it on people," Kuldeep Kumar, who runs New Bombay Palace restaurant in Kyiv, said. "My family is here. They're all Ukrainians. These are tough times...so we are helping people," he added.

354.title: Pakistan is one of the most dangerous nations in the world: US President
354.article_body: During a press briefing, US President Joe Biden called Pakistan "one of the most dangerous nations in the world". While talking about Chinese President Xi Jinping, he stated, "This is a guy who understands what he wants but has...enormous array of problems. How do we handle that? How do we handle that relative to what's going on in Russia...[and] Pakistan?"

355.title: Eight flights diverted from Mumbai airport due to heavy rainfall
355.article_body: Eight flights were diverted from Mumbai to nearby airports on Friday due to heavy rainfall and low visibility conditions. Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) notified all passengers of flight delays and provided refreshments to those waiting to board. Several parts of Mumbai, especially the eastern suburbs, received heavy rains on Friday evening.

356.title: Woman gets stuck in traffic, gives birth inside car in Gurugram
356.article_body: A woman gave birth to her baby boy inside a car after getting stuck in traffic while on the way to a hospital in Gurugram. The woman's mother-in-law said that they were stuck in traffic for about 30 minutes. The woman, who later reportedly reached the hospital in 45 minutes, and her baby boy are in healthy condition.

357.title: Fake currency notes with ₹2 lakh face value seized in Pune; 3 held
357.article_body: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence officers have seized fake Indian currency notes of ₹500 denomination with a face value of ₹2 lakh in Pune and arrested three people. The arrests were made after officers caught one of the accused, who was riding a motorcycle, with fake currency. An investigation has revealed that the fake currency was smuggled into India from Bangladesh.

358.title: Wipro senior exec Angan Guha quits, 5th senior-level exit in 2 months: Report
358.article_body: Angan Guha, a senior Wipro executive who was overseeing a third of the company's overall business, has moved out of the firm, Mint reported. Guha is the fifth senior-level executive to leave the Bengaluru-headquartered firm in the past two months. Guha was directly responsible for the largest share of Wipro's business, Americas 2 Strategic Market Unit.

359.title: ICC shares pic of all 16 captains ahead of T20 World Cup
359.article_body: The International Cricket Council (ICC) on Saturday shared a picture of all 16 captains of the teams participating in the T20 World Cup, starting on October 16. "All the 16 captains in one frame," the ICC tweeted with picture. The world cricket's governing body also shared a selfie taken by the 16 players.

360.title: 'Make-in-India' record-breaker: Piyush Goyal as phone exports hit $1 bn in Sept
360.article_body: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal lauded the government's production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme after a report claimed that India exported mobile phones worth $1 billion in September, setting a new record. "'Make-in-India' record-breaker," tweeted Goyal. Notably, the previous monthly record for mobile phone exports from India stood at $770 million in December 2021, as per the Economic Times.

361.title: India left with ordinary medium pacers: Aaqib Javed on Bumrah's injury
361.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said Team India's bowling for the T20 World Cup 2022 only comprises "ordinary medium pacers" after Jasprit Bumrah was ruled out. "Bumrah's absence is a big blow...You need someone who has an intimidating presence...India's form hasn't been great," added Javed. Javed had earlier stated that Team India should name Umran Malik as Bumrah's replacement.

362.title: Chhattisgarh announces 5% Dearness Allowance hike for govt employees
362.article_body: CM Bhupesh Baghel-led Chhattisgarh government announced a hike of 5% in the Dearness Allowance (DA) of the state government employees. The hike will be effective from October 1, 2022, and around 3.80 lakh state employees will benefit from it. With this hike in DA, those who receive salary under the 7th Pay Commission will now get 33%, an official said.

363.title: Man bites police dog while resisting arrest in Germany
363.article_body: German police on Friday said they have arrested a 29-year-old man for resisting arrest and biting a service dog. The incident happened after officers were called to a dispute between two 29-year-old men and a 35-year-old woman in Ginsheim-Gustavsburg town shortly after midnight. A police officer was injured during the incident after being punched by the woman in the face.

364.title: Traffic diversions at many places for Delhi Half Marathon on Sunday
364.article_body: Traffic restrictions will be placed at many locations in Delhi as the national capital is set to witness, after a gap of two years, a half marathon this Sunday. About 25,000 people are expected to participate in the Delhi Half Marathon. Traffic will be diverted at Aurobindo Marg-Lodhi Road Junction, Mathura Road-Bhairon Marg Junction and other places.

365.title: Turkish coal mine blast kills 25, leaves dozens trapped
365.article_body: At least 25 people have died and dozens remain trapped underground after an explosion in a coal mine in northern Turkey. A total of 110 workers were at the mine at the time of the explosion. Energy Minister Fatih Donmez said the initial indications were that the blast was caused by firedamp, a term referring to methane in coal mines.

366.title: 200 naked decomposing bodies found on rooftop of hospital in Pakistan
366.article_body: Over 200 decomposing bodies of people were found on a rooftop of a hospital in Pakistan's Punjab province, following which its CM ordered a committee to investigate the matter. Adviser to the Chief Minister Chaudhry Zaman Gujjar said, "All of the decomposing bodies were naked. Women's bodies were also not covered." The authorities ordered cremation of the bodies.

367.title: Suspect in US shooting that killed 5 identified as a 15-year-old boy
367.article_body: Police in North Carolina have said that the suspect involved in a shootout that killed five people on Thursday was a 15-year-old boy. The suspect, who is currently admitted in a hospital in critical condition, was taken into custody three hours after the shooting began in Raleigh's Hedingham neighbourhood. The motive behind the shooting is yet to be determined.

368.title: Will never ally with BJP again, will work for 'samajwadis': Bihar CM
368.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has declared that he will never ally with the BJP again and said that he will stay with the 'samajwadis' and take the country forward. "The BJP is working to create conflict in the society…Those sitting at the Centre have nothing to do with the development…BJP people keep talking nonsense," said Kumar.

369.title: Electric car goes from zero to 100 kmph in 1.461 seconds in Germany, sets world record
369.article_body: An electric car in Germany has set the Guinness World Record for the fastest electric vehicle acceleration. The carbon racing car accelerated from zero to 100 kmph in 1.461 seconds, breaking the previous world record of 1.513 seconds. A 2021 formula student car designed by the University of Stuttgart's GreenTeam was used for the attempt to set the world record.

370.title: 100 students fall ill due to suspected gas leak at school in Tamil Nadu
370.article_body: Nearly 100 students suddenly fell sick allegedly due to a suspected gas leak from a septic tank on the premises of a school in Tamil Nadu's Hosur, an official said on Friday. A total of 67 students were hospitalised following the incident. Krishnagiri District Collector V Jaya Chandra Bhanu Reddy visited the school and hospital where students were being treated.

371.title: India reports 2,430 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,618
371.article_body: India reported 2,430 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,678 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,618. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,874 following 17 casualties in the last 24 hours.

372.title: Body of missing senior Maharashtra official found in Nira river
372.article_body: The body of Joint Director of Maharashtra Directorate of Marketing Shashikant Ghorpade, who went missing two days ago, was found in the Nira river on Friday, according to police. The police said that Ghorpade's car was found in front of a hotel near the bridge on the river. Ghorpade's family had filed a missing case in Satara.

373.title: US woman told to move dog on plane abuses cabin crew, hits man with bottle; video viral
373.article_body: A video of a woman abusing cabin crew of an Atlanta to New York flight after she was told to move her dog from her lap is going viral on social media. The video shows the woman throwing a bottle of water at a male passenger who told her to get off the flight. She was removed from the aircraft.

374.title: India will be thinking about T20 WC 2021 loss vs Pak: Suresh Raina
374.article_body: Suresh Raina said India will be thinking about their loss against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2021, while planning for their upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 match against the latter. "This game won't be easy for India," added Raina. "We need to set the tone [from] the first game, win against Pakistan and the...World Cup will follow," he stated.

375.title: 79% commuters support free bus travel in Bengaluru: Report
375.article_body: About 79% of bus commuters in Bengaluru support free travel, a report by Greenpeace India showed. Based on a survey of 558 people, the report titled 'Bustling Through Bengaluru' said that the majority of respondents were in favour of free bus travel, especially for women and students. About 45% of respondents want more buses to be added to the fleet.

376.title: Bajaj Auto Q2 profit rises 20% y-o-y to ₹1,530 cr, revenue up 16%
376.article_body: Bajaj Auto Limited reported a 20% increase in its standalone net profit for the quarter ended September at ₹1,530 crore as against ₹1,274.55 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Its revenue from operations rose by 16% to ₹10,202.77 crore from ₹8,762.18 crore in the September quarter of FY22. The company's total sales increased by 0.6% to 11.51 lakh units.

377.title: Massive fire breaks out at auto parts manufacturing company in Gurugram
377.article_body: A massive fire broke out at an auto parts manufacturing company in Bilaspur Industrial area in Haryana's Gurugram on Saturday morning, officials said. No loss of life has been reported so far and the fire tenders are at the site. After hours of operations, the fire is yet to be doused completely, as per reports.

378.title: New ransomware 'Prestige' targeted Ukraine, Poland entities: Microsoft
378.article_body: Microsoft on Friday said it has detected new ransomware named 'Prestige' that targeted transportation and logistics companies in Ukraine and Poland. The ransomware was deployed on October 11 in attacks occurring within an hour of each other across all victims, Microsoft said. 'Prestige' encrypts a victim's data and asks them to purchase a decryption tool to unlock data, it added.

379.title: Murdoch considers merging Fox, News Corp nearly 10 yrs after split
379.article_body: Billionaire media mogul Rupert Murdoch is considering merging his News Corp and Fox Corporation, nearly a decade after the companies split. Both firms on Friday said they have formed special committees to review proposals for a potential combination. News Corp and Fox had market capitalisation of reportedly $9.31 billion and $16.84 billion, respectively, as of US market-close on Friday.

380.title: Saudi Arabia announces $400 million humanitarian aid to Ukraine
380.article_body: Saudi Arabia will provide $400 million in humanitarian aid to Ukraine amid the ongoing war, Saudi state news agency SPA said. Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman also spoke to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday. During the call, the Crown Prince expressed the Kingdom's readiness to continue efforts of mediation and support everything that contributes to de-escalation, SPA added.

381.title: Actress shares pic of her bruised face after being held by Iranian forces
381.article_body: Iranian actress Pantea Bahram has shared a picture of her bruised face after she was held by Iranian security forces for several days. The 52-year-old actress can be seen with a scar near her eye and one above her lips. This comes amid protests in Iran over 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death after being detained by the country's morality police.

382.title: Shree Cement elevates MD Hari Mohan Bangur to Chairman's post
382.article_body: Shree Cement's board approved the elevation of Managing Director Hari Mohan Bangur to the Chairman's post with effect from October 15. Neeraj Akhoury, the former MD & CEO of ACC and Ambuja Cements, will be appointed as its Managing Director for five years. Chairman Benu Gopal Bangur has resigned and has been appointed as Chairman Emeritus of the company.

383.title: Shree Cement Q2 profit falls 67% y-o-y to ₹189 cr, revenue up 18%
383.article_body: Shree Cement reported a 67% decline in standalone net profit at ₹189 crore in the September quarter as against a profit of ₹578 crore in the corresponding period of FY22. The profit dropped 40% from ₹316 crore during the previous quarter on a sequential basis. The firm's standalone revenues increased by 18% to ₹3,781 crore year-on-year as against ₹3,206 crore.

384.title: Frozen or packed paratha different from roti, to attract 18% GST: Gujarat AAAR
384.article_body: Gujarat's Appellate Authority for Advance Ruling (AAAR) has ruled that frozen or packed parathas will attract a GST of 18% as opposed to plain chapati or roti, which attract 5% GST. The appellate authority noted that frozen or packed parathas are different from rotis and require three to four minutes of cooking till it turns golden brown on both sides.

385.title: Traffic diversions announced in Hyd for Venkateshwara Vaibhavotsavam
385.article_body: On the final day of the celebration of Sri Venkateshwara Vaibhavotsavam on Saturday, traffic diversions will remain in place between 3 pm to 10 pm near Hyderabad's NTR Stadium. "Traffic coming from Ashok Nagar will not be allowed towards NTR Stadium and will be diverted at Bakaram Bridge towards CGO Towers and Bansilalpet," said Hyderabad Traffic Police in an advisory.

386.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging, traffic congestion in Pune
386.article_body: Some parts of Pune faced traffic congestion after roads got waterlogged due to heavy rainfall on Friday. Five tree-felling incidents were also reported from Kondhwa Budruk, Dhanori, Erandwane, Ganj Peth and Hadapsar areas in the city. India Meteorological Department (IMD) Pune official Anupam Kashyapi said, "Light rainfall is likely to continue in Pune for the next few days."

387.title: Woman kept in dog cage for 20 days after being kidnapped in Philippines, escapes
387.article_body: A Chinese woman escaped after allegedly being kidnapped during a night out and locked in a dog cage for 20 days in the Philippines. Following her disappearance, her boyfriend claimed to have received a ransom demand for $200,000 for her freedom. He was also sent a video that allegedly showed his girlfriend being beaten up by a baseball bat.

388.title: 3 arrested for smuggling mephedrone in Pune, 20.26 grams recovered
388.article_body: Pune City Police arrested three persons for allegedly smuggling and selling the banned drug mephedrone (MD). Police arrested two accused from the Lulla Nagar area after recovering 20.26 grams of MD worth ₹3 lakh from their possession. The third accused, who had allegedly provided the MD to the other two, was arrested later from Kondhwa.

389.title: 6 arrested for stabbing habitual offender to death in Hyderabad
389.article_body: Six people have been arrested for allegedly killing habitual offender Syed Bakhtiyar Agha Qureshi alias Agha shooter in Hyderabad. "On October 4, when Agha shooter reached behind Anmol hotel, the six arrested persons pounced on him and stabbed him to death with knives and daggers all of them were carrying," said DCP P Sai Chaitanya.

390.title: Over 40 rescued from Goa's Dudhsagar Falls after cable bridge collapses due to rain
390.article_body: Over 40 tourists were rescued from Goa's Dudhsagar Falls after a cable bridge collapsed due to heavy rain, as per an official statement. The incident took place on Friday evening when the water level at the waterfall rose amid heavy rain. "The River Lifesaver rescued around 40 guests...I thank and congratulate (them) for rescuing the tourists," CM Pramod Sawant tweeted.

391.title: Russia can destroy US, Europe within 30 minutes with nuclear missiles: Musk
391.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted, "Russia has the ability to destroy USA and Europe utterly with nuclear missiles in less than 30 minutes and vice versa." He added that it would be "MAD" to use the nuclear weapons. Musk earlier said, "If we were dealing with reasonable people, we wouldn't have war in the first place."

392.title: Don't push nuclear-armed Russia into a corner, warns Belarus Prez
392.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko warned Ukraine and the West against forcing his ally Russia "into a corner", saying Moscow has nuclear weapons for a reason. "Russia has clearly outlined its position: God forbid there will be an attack on the territory of the Russian Federation; in that event, Russia can use all types of weapons if necessary," Lukashenko added.

393.title: House owner shoots suspected robber dead in Ghaziabad; case filed
393.article_body: A house owner shot dead a suspected robber after he along with others allegedly tried to enter the house and opened fire in Ghaziabad's Sahibabad on Friday, police said. The SSP said that incident occurred after the house owner "retaliated by firing from his licenced pistol". An FIR under IPC's Section 398 and 459 has been filed, an SHO said.

394.title: Bengaluru on yellow alert today, light to moderate rain till Oct 19
394.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for Bengaluru for Saturday, predicting 64.5 to 115.5 mm of rainfall. It added that the city is expected to witness light to moderate rain till October 19. Parts of the city, including Indiranagar, Mahadevapura and HSR Layout, saw waterlogging after 66 mm of rainfall on Friday.

395.title: 5-foot-long checkered keelback snake spotted at Amit Shah's house
395.article_body: A five-foot-long checkered keelback, commonly known as Asiatic water snake, was spotted at Union Home Minister Amit Shah's residence on Thursday. "Geared with rescue equipment, a two-member rescue team rushed to the snake's aid...We are grateful to the security personnel working in the Union Home Minister's residence for alerting Wildlife SOS to this emergency," Wildlife SOS said.

396.title: Tata Power hit by cyberattack, says 'all critical operational systems functioning'
396.article_body: Tata Power has confirmed that it was hit by a cyberattack that impacted some of its IT systems. "[We have] taken steps to retrieve and restore the systems. All critical operational systems are functioning," the power generation company wrote in a statement to stock exchanges. Tata Power has restricted access for employee and customer facing portals as a precautionary measure.

397.title: Rickshaw driver killed, 2 others injured in multi-vehicle crash in Delhi
397.article_body: A 40-year-old rickshaw driver died and two others were injured after an RTV (Rural Transport Vehicle) bus, a rickshaw, an auto-rickshaw and a motorcycle crashed near Kalkaji Depot in Delhi's Okhla, police said. The RTV driver lost balance and hit other vehicles, police added. The 26-year-old driver was apprehended on the spot, police further said.

398.title: He was one of the funniest people I've met: Daniel Radcliffe on Robbie Coltrane's demise
398.article_body: Daniel Radcliffe, who portrayed the titular role in the 'Harry Potter' films, mourned the demise of Robbie Coltrane, who portrayed Hagrid. "Robbie was one of the funniest people I've met and used to keep us laughing constantly as kids on the set," Radcliffe said. "He was an incredible actor and a lovely man," he added.

399.title: Bangladesh make 2 last-minute changes to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad
399.article_body: Bangladesh have made two last-minute changes to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad after the tri-series in New Zealand. Soumya Sarkar and Shoriful Islam have been included in the final 15-member group. The duo replace Sabbir Rahman and Mohammad Saifuddin in the squad. Both Shoriful and Sarkar were initially named in the reserves for the tournament.

400.title: India briefs G-20 countries on its agenda ahead of presidency
400.article_body: India has briefed the member nations of the G20 on the agenda that New Delhi will be pursuing when it assumes the grouping's rotating presidency next year. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das elaborated on India's agenda during a G20 leaders meeting in Washington on Thursday. Details of the agenda were not disclosed.
